alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 5:21PM MDT until July 08 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL TAOS, WESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have ended for now over northern parts of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Up to 1.25 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The main drainages impacted were Rito San Jose, Manuelitas Creek, Rio La Casa, and Canoncito Creek. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mora, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, Cleveland, Tierra Monte, La Cueva, Holman, Gascon, Sapello, Chacon, South Carmen, Monte Aplanado, Luceros, Rainsville, Rociada, Manuelitas, Golondrinas, El Turquillo, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County and Guadalupita. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 9 and 47. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 15. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
